org.jsfml.audio

Class SoundBufferRecorder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsfml.internal.SFMLNativeObject
      • org.jsfml.audio.SoundRecorder
        • org.jsfml.audio.SoundBufferRecorder

  • public class SoundBufferRecorder
extends SoundRecorder
    A SoundRecorder which stores captured audio data into a SoundBuffer.

      • getBuffer

        public ConstSoundBuffer getBuffer()
        Gets the sound buffer containing the captured audio data.

        The sound buffer will remain empty until any sound has been successfully captured using the SoundRecorder.start(int) and SoundRecorder.stop() methods.

        Returns:
        the sound buffer containing the captured audio data.

      • onStart

        protected final boolean onStart()
        Description copied from class: SoundRecorder
        Called when the sound recorder starts recording.

        This method can be implemented by deriving classes to perform any actions necessary before audio recording actually starts.

        Specified by:
        onStart in class SoundRecorder
        Returns:
        true to start recording after this method is done, false to cancel.

      • onProcessSamples

        protected final boolean onProcessSamples(short[] samples)
        Description copied from class: SoundRecorder
        Called when a new batch of audio samples comes in.

        Implementing classes can then process the captured audio data.

        Note that this method will be called in a separate audio capturing thread.

        Also note that this method is currently hardcoded to be called every 100ms, which might be changed in the future.

        Specified by:
        onProcessSamples in class SoundRecorder
        Parameters:
        samples - the 16-bit mono samples that were captured.
        Returns:
        true to continue recording after this method is done, false to stop recording.

      • onStop

        protected final void onStop()
        Description copied from class: SoundRecorder
        Called when the audio capture has stopped.

        Note that this method will be called in a separate audio capturing thread.

        Specified by:
        onStop in class SoundRecorder
